text: The representer theorem states that any function that takes the form: f^* \in \arg\min_{f \in \mathcal{H_k}} \sum_{i=1}^{n}\ell(f(x_i),y_i) + \Omega({\Vert f \Vert}^2_\mathcal{H_k}) where \ell (\cdot) is any loss function and \Omega(\cdot) is any regularization term, the optimal solution, \mathcal{f}^*, will take the form: \mathcal{f}^* = \sum_{i=1}^{n} \alpha_i k(x_i, \cdot) Where k(x_i, \cdot) is a kernel. Category:Mathematics
title: Representer theorem
